poem:
**Inoculation**

In fields where feathered secrets scatter,
autumn winds carry the whisper of precaution.
The needle's point, a small promise against
an unseen adversary, glints in morning sun.
Farmers, with hands still clinging to earth,
now grasp flimsy sleeves of protection,
their breath mingling with the world's,
warding off silent, winged conspirators.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Flu vaccine will curb bird flu risk for US farm workers, CDC deputy director says In the face of serious concerns over the spreading bird flu virus in US agriculture, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is pushing a major flu vaccination campaign among farm workers in a bid to prevent healthcare strain and combat potential mutations from the highly pathogenic bird virus. Part of the campaign will seek to combat disinformation". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Flu vaccine will curb bird flu risk for US farm workers, CDC deputy director says In the face of serious concerns over the spreading bird flu virus in US agriculture, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is pushing a major flu vaccination campaign among farm workers in a bid to prevent healthcare strain and combat potential mutations from the highly pathogenic bird virus. Part of the campaign will seek to combat disinformation
